<a id="TouchScreenButton"></a>

# TouchScreenButton

**Inherits:** [Node2D](Node2D.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Button for touch screen devices for gameplay use.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

TouchScreenButton allows you to create on-screen buttons for touch devices. It's intended for gameplay use, such as a unit you have to touch to move. Unlike [Button](Button.md), TouchScreenButton supports multitouch out of the box. Several TouchScreenButtons can be pressed at the same time with touch input.

This node inherits from [Node2D](Node2D.md). Unlike with [Control](Control.md) nodes, you cannot set anchors on it. If you want to create menus or user interfaces, you may want to use [Button](Button.md) nodes instead. To make button nodes react to touch events, you can enable [ProjectSettings.input_devices/pointing/emulate_mouse_from_touch](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_input_devices/pointing/emulate_mouse_from_touch) in the Project Settings.

You can configure TouchScreenButton to be visible only on touch devices, helping you develop your game both for desktop and mobile devices.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_action"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_bitmask"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[BitMap](BitMap.md) **bitmask** [ðŸ”—](#TouchScreenButton_property_bitmask)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_bitmask**\ (\ value\: [BitMap](BitMap.md)\ )
- [BitMap](BitMap.md) **get_bitmask**\ (\ )

The button's bitmask.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_passby_press"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **passby_press** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#TouchScreenButton_property_passby_press)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_passby_press**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_passby_press_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the [pressed](TouchScreenButton.md#TouchScreenButton_signal_pressed) and [released](TouchScreenButton.md#TouchScreenButton_signal_released) signals are emitted whenever a pressed finger goes in and out of the button, even if the pressure started outside the active area of the button.

\ **Note:** This is a "pass-by" (not "bypass") press mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Shape2D](Shape2D.md) **shape** [ðŸ”—](#TouchScreenButton_property_shape)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shape**\ (\ value\: [Shape2D](Shape2D.md)\ )
- [Shape2D](Shape2D.md) **get_shape**\ (\ )

The button's shape.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_shape_centered"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **shape_centered** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#TouchScreenButton_property_shape_centered)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shape_centered**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_shape_centered**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button's shape is centered in the provided texture. If no texture is used, this property has no effect.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TouchScreenButton_property_shape_visible"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **shape_visible** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#TouchScreenButton_property_shape_visible)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shape_visible**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_shape_visible**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button's shape is visible in the editor.
